title: Honoring Lawrence Bosch, exemplary police officer and true public servant, and recognizing the significance of his service to his community
fulltext:
LEGISLATIVE RESOLUTION honoring Lawrence Bosch, exemplary police officer
and true public servant, and recognizing the significance of his service
to his community and the people of the State of New York

WHEREAS,  The  quality  and  sanctity  of  community  life are cherished
values, worthy of safeguarding, and this Legislative Body  is  moved  to
honor  those  individuals who serve to preserve and protect such values,
lauding particularly their unwavering  courage  and  dedication  in  the
daily performance of their duties; and
  WHEREAS,  It  is appropriate to recognize and commend such outstanding
law enforcement officers as Lawrence Bosch  for  their  valued  contrib-
utions to the community; and
  WHEREAS,  New  York  City Police Officer and Carroll Gardens resident,
Lawrence Bosch was appointed to the police force on  January  20,  2004;
and
  WHEREAS, In February of 2005, Police Officer Bosch was assigned to the
84th Precinct in Brooklyn, New York; and
  WHEREAS,  Police Officer Bosch patrols commercial hotspots such as the
Fulton Mall, which was recently hit with a spate of robberies and quali-
ty of life offenses, keeping residents, shoppers and merchants on  edge;
and
  WHEREAS, Police Officer Bosch's tremendous energy, zeal and dedication
to  the safety of the community are among the factors that have led to a
sharp decrease in crime along Fulton and Hoyt streets; and
  WHEREAS, Police Officer Bosch made 54 arrests in  2010,  and  for  his
efforts, he has earned the nickname "Book 'em Bosch"; and
  WHEREAS,  These arrests covered a wide variety of crimes, ranging from
larcenies to armed robberies to three-card monte scams to illegal  ciga-
rette sales; and
  WHEREAS,  Police  Office Bosch was named as the 84th Precinct's Police
Officer of the Year for 2010; and
  WHEREAS, It is the custom of this Legislative Body  that  those  dedi-
cated  public servants who unselfishly devote their lives to the preser-
vation of order and the protection of others are  worthy  and  due  full
praise for their commitment and noble endeavors; now, therefore, be it
  RESOLVED,  That  this  Legislative  Body pause in its deliberations to
honor Lawrence Bosch, exemplary police officer and true public  servant,
recognizing  the  significance  of  his service to his community and the
people of the State of New York; and be it further
  RESOLVED, That a copy of this Resolution, suitably engrossed, be tran-
smitted to Police Officer Lawrence Bosch.
